results.content:
I think this could be helpful for getting broad exposure to Spring, despite its being billed as an "interview questions" course.  It actually steered me toward questioning things I'd seen in other courses.  In particular, Ranga's explanation of service URI naming standards was borne out with other sites from RESTful authorities.

There were minor mistakes here and there, which I posted.  But otherwise a good course.  Don't think it will teach you all about Spring, but it could give you enough exposure that you can decide what to look at more closely.
results.content_html:
I think this could be helpful for getting broad exposure to Spring, despite its being billed as an "interview questions" course. It actually steered me toward questioning things I'd seen in other courses. In particular, Ranga's explanation of service URI naming standards was borne out with other sites from RESTful authorities.

There were minor mistakes here and there, which I posted. But otherwise a good course. Don't think it will teach you all about Spring, but it could give you enough exposure that you can decide what to look at more closely.

results.content: This course is very useful before attending interview. You can increase the audio speed to 1.5 ;) and go through the content quickly. It helped me to refresh the contents and did boost confidence for the interview.
results.content_html: This course is very useful before attending interview. You can increase the audio speed to 1.5 ;) and go through the content quickly. It helped me to refresh the contents and did boost confidence for the interview.

results.content:
I found it to be a good comprehensive introduction for someone who is just learning Spring and Spring Boot.  I'm sure it would also be excellent for someone who had with some experience and just needed a review to freshen their understanding.
Maybe add a little more reference to the associated example code.
results.content_html:
I found it to be a good comprehensive introduction for someone who is just learning Spring and Spring Boot. I'm sure it would also be excellent for someone who had with some experience and just needed a review to freshen their understanding.
Maybe add a little more reference to the associated example code.

results.content: Yes this course is good match for me. I am J2SE developer from seven years. I worked to consume REST etc API's throughout the career.  From last six months I am focusing working towards  back-end development. I completed 6 courses in 6 months from various sources. This is the seventh month were I want to cover the ground with a quick revision. This gave me enough confidence. I will try to answer the listed questions and practice. I am looking for an opportunity to work on spring boot and microservices. I had an experience in the past as an assistant professor for an year as well.

results.content: The course is awesome. It covered a wide range of information. It is not only good for interview but also enhances and brushes up skills. This course also helps to fill up the gaps in the knowledge and skillset. This course is useful for all types of students such as beginner, junior and seniors level

results.content: Really such a wonderful course for Beginners...The way Ranga sir taught from the preview course video to last video is amazing.. A good teacher with skilled in topics.. Ranga want to explain even a minute code change to us is an extraordinary part.. This is my  5th course of Ranga Sir in this 3 months.. Started with Spring MVC then went on with Java Interview guide, Spring and Spring boot interview guide, JSP and Servlets and finally finished this Spring Boot Beginner to Expert.. There are still 4 more courses are in MyCourses section of Ranga Sir..  Hibernate, RESTful, Spring Master class and Microservices... Amazing effort sir by you towards us... Thanks for replying to me in Linkedin when i wished you privately on your birthday ..

results.content: This is a really wonderful course. The teacher is very clear in his explanations and extremely efficient in terms of delivering the concepts. The material is presented with a very clear focus on the topic with very little departure from the topic. The conversational tone of the lectures is very engaging and you can listen to the lectures for hours on end without the slightest feeling of fatigue. I will definitely take more courses from this course instructor.
